greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Derangement numbers d(n,5) where d(n,k) = k(n-1)(d(n-1,k) + d(n-2,k)), with d(0,k) = 1 and d(1,k) = 0.
comment: In general, d(n,k) is asymptotic to sqrt(2*Pi) * k^n * n^(n + 1/2) / (Gamma(1/k) * exp((n*k+1)/k) * n^((k-1)/k)), for k>0. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Oct 31 2017
formula: Inverse binomial transform of A008548. E.g.f.: exp(-x)/(1-5*x)^(1/5). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Dec 17 2003
a(n) ~ Pi * sqrt(2) * n^(n-3/10) * 5^n / (sqrt(Pi) * Gamma(1/5) * exp(n + 1/5)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Oct 31 2017
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 02 2003
